subject: Football
lead_paragraph: The N.F.L. agreed to let the receiver formerly known as Chad Johnson wear his new name on the back of his jersey this season. But it is not exactly as he wanted it. Instead of Ocho Cinco, he will be Ochocinco. The receiver legally changed his name in Florida last August and asked the league and the news media to call him Chad Ocho Cinco, a two-word nickname he had adopted referring to his No. 85. The league insisted on the one-word version because that was how he wrote it when he submitted his name-change form. ¶The star-crossed Bengals are about to become HBO’s latest stars. HBO and NFL Films chose one of the least successful and most dysfunctional teams of the past 18 years for its next “Hard Knocks” training camp series. “We just think there’s an interesting mix of personalities,” said Steve Sabol, president of NFL Films. hardknocks.
